patterns.title: Complete Map of Time
patterns.subtitle: Past, Present, Future, Eternal
patterns.description: The four quadrants touch every dimension of time—past, present, future, and the eternal now.
patterns.whyItMatters: When we only focus on the urgent present, we lose context and vision. This framework ensures you're connected to all of time—rooted in the past, present in this moment, asking eternal questions, and envisioning the future.
patterns.reflection: Which dimension of time do you naturally gravitate toward? Which do you avoid?

patterns.title: The Cross/Axis Structure
patterns.subtitle: Heaven & Earth, Past & Future
patterns.description: The framework forms a cross when mapped as coordinates—horizontal (time) and vertical (dimension).
patterns.whyItMatters: The cross is humanity's oldest symbol for integration—bringing together heaven and earth, past and future. This framework literally enacts that integration.
patterns.reflection: Do you tend to live more on the horizontal axis (time-focused) or vertical axis (dimension-focused)? What would balance look like?

patterns.title: Every Relationship You'll Ever Have
patterns.subtitle: Self, Other, Divine, Ancestors, Community
patterns.description: Each quadrant engages a different primary relationship.
patterns.whyItMatters: Human wholeness requires all four relationships. When any one is neglected, we become unbalanced. This framework ensures no relationship is forgotten.
patterns.reflection: Which relationship feels most alive for you right now? Which needs attention?

patterns.title: Four Ways of Knowing
patterns.subtitle: Empirical, Revelatory, Historical, Intuitive
patterns.description: Each quadrant represents a different epistemology—a different way humans discover truth.
patterns.whyItMatters: We're taught to privilege one way of knowing (usually empirical or scriptural), but truth comes through all four channels. This framework honors every way humans can know something.
patterns.reflection: Which way of knowing feels most natural to you? Which have you been taught to distrust?

patterns.title: The Veil's Four Positions
patterns.subtitle: This Side, At, Across, Dissolving
patterns.description: The framework doesn't just cross the veil once—it engages it from every possible angle.

mapping.observe: Working on this side of the veil (with the living)
mapping.ask: Standing at the veil (temple as threshold)

patterns.whyItMatters: 'On either side of the veil' isn't just about the living and the dead—it's about visible/invisible, outer/inner, material/spiritual. This framework teaches you to honor multiple dimensions of reality.
patterns.reflection: Where do you most naturally engage with 'the other side'? What would it mean to approach it from all four angles?

patterns.title: Action-Contemplation Rhythm
patterns.subtitle: Preventing Burnout Through Balance
patterns.description: The quadrants alternate between doing and being, preventing burnout.

mapping.remember: Active research (doing the work, building trees)

patterns.whyItMatters: All action with no contemplation leads to exhaustion. All contemplation with no action leads to stagnation. This framework builds rest into the cycle.
patterns.reflection: Are you more naturally action-oriented or contemplation-oriented? What would balance feel like?

patterns.title: Jung's Four Functions of Consciousness
patterns.subtitle: Sensation, Thinking, Feeling, Intuition
patterns.description: Carl Jung identified four fundamental ways the psyche processes reality. This framework maps perfectly to them.
patterns.whyItMatters: Jung argued that psychological wholeness requires developing all four functions. Most people have one or two that dominate. This framework ensures you're touching all four, even if some feel uncomfortable.
patterns.reflection: Which function is your 'home base'? Which one challenges you most?

patterns.title: The Cycle of Transformation
patterns.subtitle: How All Growth Happens
patterns.description: This is literally how all growth, healing, and learning happen—in any domain.

mapping.step3: REMEMBER — You integrate it with your story (context provides meaning)
mapping.step4: IMAGINE — You envision how to move forward (possibility emerges)
mapping.step5: Back to OBSERVE — You notice what changed

patterns.whyItMatters: This is how therapy works. How education works. How scientific discovery works. How spiritual awakening works. The framework isn't prescribing anything artificial—it's describing the natural cycle of human development.
patterns.reflection: Where are you in this cycle right now with your biggest current challenge?

patterns.title: The Breath Cycle
patterns.subtitle: The Most Fundamental Human Rhythm
patterns.description: The four quadrants map to the four phases of breathing—the most fundamental human rhythm.

mapping.ask: Hold at the top (pause, contemplation, fullness)
mapping.imagine: Hold at the bottom (emptiness, potential, before new creation)

patterns.whyItMatters: The framework literally breathes. It's rhythmic, cyclical, life-giving. You can't rush it. You can't skip steps. It moves at the pace of life itself.
patterns.reflection: Can you feel the breath rhythm in your spiritual practice? What phase are you in right now?

patterns.title: Fractal (Scale-Free) Structure
patterns.subtitle: The Same Pattern at Every Scale
patterns.description: The same 4-part cycle repeats at every scale, from micro to cosmic.

mapping.micro: One conversation: observe what they need → ask how to help → remember similar situations → imagine what's possible
mapping.daily: One day: morning awareness → midday prayer → afternoon reflection → evening planning
mapping.lifetime: One lifetime: present awareness → seeking understanding → integrating your story → envisioning legacy
mapping.cosmic: All time: current dispensation → revelatory moments → honoring ancestors → millennial gathering

patterns.whyItMatters: Because it's fractal, you can practice this at any scale. You don't need to 'do big things.' The pattern works in a 5-minute interaction just as well as in a 40-year life arc.
patterns.reflection: What's the smallest scale where you could practice this today?

patterns.title: The Scientific Method
patterns.subtitle: How Humans Discover Truth
patterns.description: This is how humans discover truth in any domain—secular or sacred.

mapping.remember: Research (review existing knowledge, check the literature)
mapping.imagine: Theory (propose what could be, test predictions)

patterns.whyItMatters: The framework isn't 'religious vs. scientific.' It's how consciousness itself works. Science and spirituality use the same underlying pattern because it's the pattern of discovery itself.
patterns.reflection: Have you been taught that faith and inquiry oppose each other? What if they're the same motion?

patterns.title: Perfect Gender Balance
patterns.subtitle: Masculine & Feminine Energy
patterns.description: The quadrants alternate between receptive (feminine) and active (masculine) energy.
patterns.whyItMatters: Neither masculine nor feminine energy is privileged. Both are essential. The framework won't work if you only do half. You need to receive AND initiate, rest AND act.
patterns.reflection: Which energy feels more natural to you? What would it mean to honor both?
